page.title: 05THE RIVER KENNET
page.content: The{Kennet}is a manmade river and the flow is now controlled by four sluice gates which the river baliff, John Hounslow, is in charge of.It is at least 500 years old,and may even be Roman.The source of the river is at Broad Hinton and it joins the Thames at Kingston.No boats are allowed on the Kennet and it never freezes over.People pay to fish in the river.On our survey of the river we found several kinds of plant including water crowfoot,water starwart, canadian pondweed and watercress.We also found shrimps, mayfly nymphs, caddisfly larvae, leeches,water_rats and coots.The speed is 130cm per second at its fastest point,and its temperature on the day of the survey was 13 degrees C.Its pH is 7.It is 27cm and 178cm deep and is 12.1m wide here.
